request_pathways.name: Duly Authorization for Release of Health Information
MediCopy Authorization for Release of Medical Records

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients download a generic HIPAA authorization PDF, print and fill it by hand, and submit via fax or email to ScanSTAT Technologies; a 'Personal Reasons' purpose checkbox is the only nod to patient self-access.

red_flags: Witness signature required for non-care requests (Personal Reasons, Insurance, Legal) — not required by HIPAA
Categorically rejects 'all records' requests, potentially limiting patient Right of Access under 45 CFR § 164.524
Fee language ('Charges may apply. Please contact us for details. Cash payments are not accepted.') provides no transparency and no acknowledgment of HIPAA fee limits for patient access
bright_spots: Five delivery methods offered: fax, U.S. mail, MyChart, secure e-delivery, and pick-up
Granular record-type checkboxes with 11 categories including imaging CDs
Explicit date format examples reduce ambiguity
Comprehensive patient rights statements covering revocation, inspection, right to refuse, and re-disclosure

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms were easy to find via basic web search, and a dedicated medical records request page exists at dulyhealthandcare.com/services/medical-records-requests; not a 5 because the primary form isn't immediately prominent without searching.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: The PDF has a text layer but zero fillable fields, requiring print-and-handwrite workflow; fax and email submission are available, preventing a score of 2, but the lack of any digital form completion keeps it from 4.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Six clearly numbered sections with logical flow, granular record-type checkboxes, and date format examples; minor issues include dense legal text block in Section 6, outdated branding references, and vague fee language.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the form by selecting 'Personal Reasons' but the form was not designed for patient self-access — it conflates patient access with third-party release, applies the same witness and fee requirements to all requests, and does not acknowledge the patient's distinct Right of Access.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Witness requirement for non-care requests, categorical rejection of 'all records' requests, and opaque fee language go beyond what HIPAA requires for patient access, though rights statements and revocation language are present.

overall.summary: Duly Health and Care provides a findable, well-organized ROI form with good delivery flexibility, but funnels all requests through a generic authorization with unnecessary barriers — witness requirements, fee opacity, and no differentiation of patient self-access from third-party release.
